title: Flies Great, and hoovers nicely….
text:
[[VIDEOID:a82bea16b96df4bccdec452b432a6ecf]] Great flying once you set it up!!! We had to take a few minutes to figure out how to start this.
Turn on drone
Turn on remote
Wait 5 seconds
Point both joysticks down and a tad to the right
Then hit the calibration button in on top left of remote
Manually turn the drone left in 3 circles
Set the drone down
Then manually turn drone to the right in 3 circles

Then your all set. The drone is smooth and responsive. Hovering capabilities are great.

title: A great classic game supersized!!!
text: [[VIDEOID:3cf69d2cf1d832e91538f8f36d12d550]] Wow, really love this.  Watching kids play this is a lot of fun at or church and community events. title: Absolutely the Best Drone in this price range!!!!
text: [[VIDEOID:3eb9acea61fd7211457ccdb2406b5fb0]] Flying this you would never guess that it was under the asking price of $35. The three speeds is also so fun and easy!  It even includes 2 batteries!  You have almost an hour of flying without using the lights.  I am so impressed by this drone that it makes many more expensive ones look like toys.  Seriously, you can't go wrong with this drone.  Very Impressed!!!

title: Fast spinning spinners with lights
text: [[VIDEOID:ae40202febbbdae94be968f8ec1edee1]] Very fast spins with just a little touch. title: Very nice, but nothing great.

title: True independent suspension, very fast, and great turn ratio!
text: [[VIDEOID:d639bf6154a3903405253e37232b7325]] Wow, super all terrain truck. title: Works great, but turning ratio is gradual

title: Perfect first motorized power wheels

title: The Hype is Real!!!  Intuitive and Interactive...
text:
Very Seldom does a toy meets all the Hype, but this one does!!!

title: love the design... the edge pieces are a nightmare!
text: alright, my so and I have turned game nights into puzzle nights and we loved the look of this particular puzzle.  The scenes are cute, the characters are ones we know from Disney films, and at 1000 pieces we figured it would be a piece of cake to do right????  Wrong.  We started to do the edging pieces and discovered they were all way too similar and it was almost impossible to tell where they were actually supposed to go. ie, they fit in every single spot that they could fit regardless if that was where they belonged or not.  So we figured we'd go ahead and do the scenes of the puzzle and then work in the edge afterwards.  Yeah, well that didn't work either.  We finally made sure we got the corners right since there the design is different (characters) and just winged it for the rest of the edge pieces.  We actually spent longer trying to get the edge right than we did for the main part of the puzzle (and since the puzzle is small, it's extremely difficult to 'see' the subtle differences in the design.  Cute design but the edge pieces are frustrating.

title: beautiful but hard puzzle

title: beautiful puzzle - now a priced piece on the wall in the living room.
text:
we just completed this puzzle the day before yesterday and couldn't be happier! We opted to assemble it inside a frame [[ASIN:B01N39WPJS Black Poster Frame 29x40 Inches, 1.25" SnapeZo Profile, Front Loading Quick Poster Change, Wall Mounted, Professional Series]] which was rather spendy but it's beautiful and the frame actually has hinged sides so you just snap them down once the puzzle's glued together and hang it.

The puzzle itself it large and took up more room than we had on the table (hence the need for a frame to build it on) but we had so much fun putting it together. My son is autistic so it was overwhelming for him at first but we worked on the borders between the scenes and had different bins for the various scenes so once we found pieces and knew where they belonged we'd put them in their designated baggie. He really got into it once we started seeing the scenes come together - and loved it when I was stumped by various pieces and he was able to find them. Honestly - it's a great puzzle for the entire family!

On a side note, while we were not missing any pieces there is a flyer in the box letting you know that if you are missing a piece you can note on the flyer where the piece is and send the paper to the company and they will get the missing piece to you. I'm soooo impressed with that I just had to mention it! Top notch company

title: you can never go wrong with Lego!
text: what can I say... it's LEGO!!! You can never go wrong with Lego!  That being said, my son isn't a big Batman fan but he loves all things Lego so I took the chance and got this kit for him only to be told that 'all Batman vehicles are cool' so it was an unexpected kudos for me!  He did have the kit put together relatively quickly and it's not proudly displayed along with his assortment of Lego Star Wars ships/vehicles.  Seriously, if you have a Batman fan or just a Lego fan in general you're buying for then you can't go wrong with this Batwing building set.

title: cute toy for young mobile children BUT don't forget the batteries!
text:
not sure who enjoyed this toy more - my handicapped sister in law or their dog. She got a huge kick out of watching the balls fly out of My Little Pony and the dog loved chasing them around the room. Of course the adults all had to take turns gathering the balls to put them back in so the fun can continue. I think a young child who is highly mobile would love chasing the balls and listening to the music from this toy. My sister in law has a hard time moving about so for her it was all about the music and watching the dog chasing the balls... and maybe forcing adults to scurry about retrieving them all for her.

Quick note... make sure you purchase 4 D size batteries BEFORE showing this toy to a child... we forgot about that little issue and the results were not pleasant.

title: cute game - could be fun with more than 2 players

Now that might very well be just because they do enjoy the hilarity and hijinks that go on when there are 3 or more people playing (and it's entirely possible they could love this game if there were more people to play it)

title: beloved game - updated!
text:
great game we loved as kids and now play with our son. We love how it electronically keeps track of everyone's money but the game pieces otherwise are the same as before. The only complaint I have is the box the game is stored in. Instead of the liftable box top that most games use it's a cheap thin cardboard giftbox type box that you slide everything out of the end and then have to slide it all back in and fold up the flap. That's going to get ripped and the flap is going to get worn out quickly.

The game of Life is as fun as it's ever been but I think they could have put more thought into the game case design.

title: perfect for young Dora fans!
text: We originally got the Dora Fiesta Favorites Kitchen because we thought it would be a good idea to have a 'girl' toy in the house when our nieces visit, however, we got an unexpected bonus when my husband's handicapped step-sister who suffers cerebal palsy discovered it.  Wendy loves Dora the Explorer and while I knew she'd love the sounds aspect of this toy I never expected her to actually want to sit down on the floor and play with the kitchen.  Normally she shows no interest in doing anything but she was actually trying to use her troubled hand and showed no frustration with her lack of abilities.  The kitchen is built well and provides hours of fun for the young - and young at heart.  The colors are eye catching and the kids really enjoyed pretending to cook. I do have to say, as an adult though, hearing Dora all day long does get rather irritating.  LOL Though I'll also admit, the Fed Ex delivery guy got a kick out of the box talking to him while he was on his route.

title: Great fun!
text:
My first impression of the 3 hole bean bag toss is it's well built and great fun (seriously, with the rain, we actually set the game up in the living room and laughed while chunking the little bean bags at the board) - and he loved being able to keep track of the score using the slider things on the side of the boards.

My only complaints are the carry all bag could have been a bit bigger so that it isn't such a challenge to get everything 'just so' in order to fit it back in there. A zipper pouch on the side might have been a nice touch for the bean bags. We've hit the point we don't even try to put everything back in the bag - just stack everything to one side of the living room (yep it's been raining practically since this game arrived). and the plastic 'stands' are a little difficult to get into the holes in the board so that they can stand up.

All in all this is a fun game for all ages or athletic abilities so everyone can feel included!

title: fast paced and a whole lotta fun
text:
My son and I spent the evening playing this game last night and had a blast. There's no doubt about it, you have to be on your toes and pay very close attention to what's going on - certainly have to keep your eye on the light because when it stops on you you get a specified amount of time before the buzzer goes off and you're stuck drawing two cards. We started out without any time limits but then Cody decided that we had to make it more challenging and that's when things go really interesting.

If you're a fan the traditional Uno game then you'll really enjoy playing this one - and I'm guessing that if you have more players then it would be a game that you could spend the evening playing with friends. We laughed, yelled, panicked, but most importantly smiled our way through 6 games of Uno Flash before it was time to call it a night. This is the perfect game for family game night.

text: I got this for my Labrador/Husky mix. He's about 80 pounds and this float could support both him and my youngest daughter at the same time. He's got fairly sharp claws, but the float held up even as he scrambled to get on. He enjoys sitting on this float and we can even pull him behind our stand up paddle boards. I would recommend purchasing a small air compressor because it takes a while to inflate. This is a nice item that will allow your dog to enjoy a day on the water.

title: Fun Princess Castle Building Set
text:
As an educator, I'm always happy to get my children building sets like this one. At 554 pieces, it is complex enough to be a challenge, but it isn't so difficult that your child will get discouraged. The instructions are easy to follow and they allow your child to develop their concentration and problem solving skills.

The set features high quality pieces that are durable and will not break under normal use. The final build is colorful, and this is a set that your child can take apart and put together again and again. Building sets help improve both your child's ability to follow directions and their ability to think creatively.

This set comes in attractive packaging, and the pieces are labeled in individual bags. It's a good product and would make a thoughtful gift.

title: A Fun Way to Have a Real Harry Potter Experience
text:
My daughter is an absolute fanatic for anything related to Harry Potter and she was delighted with this game. It does take a little bit of time to set up the wand and get it to work correctly, but that was probably the part that my daughter liked the most.

This game does a good job of recreating what feels like a genuine Hogwarts experience. My daughter is always making wands and waving them around, so having one that seems to write magically on a screen was really fun for her. If you want to play it just as Pictionary, you can always resort to a regular paper and pencil.

I found it was just as much fun playing with the wand as it was playing the actual game. The game has very attractive packaging and would make a good gift. This Harry Potter Pictionary game is an excellent choice for Harry Potter fans of all ages.

title: Fun Building Set
text: This is a very fun building set that would make a great present or a fun activity a parent might share with his or her child. It is a 290 piece set so it is complex enough to create a sense of achievement, but not so large that it is too much of a challenge. The pieces are colorful and the instructions are easy to follow. This item comes in an attractive box and would be an ideal gift for Christmas or a birthday. Building sets like these teach problem solving and help develop the ability to follow precise directions. This is a fun building set that will both entertain and educate your child.

title: Fun Barbie With Hairstyling Feature
text: My daughters are still young enough to enjoy playing with Barbie dolls, and they absolutely loved this figure. The doll comes in very nice packaging that makes it an ideal selection for a birthday or Christmas gift. The doll has a vibrantly colored dress, and includes a hairstyling tool that allows your child to create some wonderful hairstyles. This is a nice product that will provide your child with hours of fun.

title: A Summer's Worth of Chalk
text:
This is an excellent set of sidewalk chalk. I have two girls aged 11 and 8 and they have always loved to sit on the sidewalk on a nice summer day and make illustrations with chalk. It's a great way to get them away from television and computer screens. I always prefer to have them doing something that's artistic.

They were very excited to get this set because it contains colors that they haven't found in a chalk set before. The chalk sticks are a jumbo size and feel like any other chalk stick. The set arrived in good shape although one row of chalk had fallen over in transit. None of the chalk sticks were damaged however. This is a wonderful way to ensure your kids have plenty of chalk for a whole summer's worth of fun.

title: Very Effective Learning Tool
text:
This is a wonderful set of durable flash cards that will provide a tremendous boost to your child's reading skills. The cards are very large and colorful which makes them easy to see without straining your eyes. There are 50 words in each group from pre-k to grade 3, and the set also includes 50 blank cards for when you discover words that give your child trouble.

You'll see huge benefits if you take the time to go through a set of cards as little as one time per day. When your child can rattle off all 50 cards instantly, s/he will feel much more confident in his/her reading skills. Flash cards are one of the most effective learning tools available, and this is a great set for making home learning convenient and fun.

title: Makes A Great Gift
text:
This doll has the head, arms, and torso of a regular Barbie, but instead of legs it features the tail of a mermaid. The tail fin comes unattached and can be easily snapped onto the doll after the package has been opened. In different water temperatures, the hair and mermaid tail change colors. This doll is a wonderful product for children who do not like bath time. My two daughters were excited to take it into the tub and see the color change.

The packaging is very attractive and this is an excellent item to give as a gift. This is a unique Barbie doll and is a great accessory for the beach, pool or bath.

title: Makes a Great Gift
text: This is a very nice Barbie doll that comes with a variety of accessories. Out of the box, the doll looks like any other Barbie with regular human feet. The mermaid flippers and the vibrantly colored tail can be added and removed as desired. The doll also includes a hair brush, tiara, wand and necklace. It comes in a brightly colored package that works very well as a Christmas or birthday present. Anyone who loves Barbie dolls is sure to be delighted with this product.

title: Great For Improving Math Skills
text:
My kids have been enrolled in virtual learning this year and I've noticed that they needed more practice with their math skills. This game is a great way to combine family time with the necessary rote memorization that helps your children succeed at school.

My eldest daughter is in 5th grade and she's just starting to learn some more complex mathematical concepts. These concepts become even more difficult to understand if she has to pause in the middle of a problem and try to remember her multiplication tables.

This board game combines simple gameplay with basic math problems. It allows your kids to get the necessary practice they need to feel confident with their math skills. This is a much better way to practice multiplication tables than by using flashcards. The social and competitive elements of this game make it a very valuable educational tool.

title: My Kids Love It
text:
My kids absolutely love playing with slime. This is a very fun kit that includes various containers of colored slime, glitter, and other fun items. This is not a slime mixing kit, the slime comes pre-made so there is less potential for a mess.

In an age of digital screen addiction, kits like these are a great way to encourage your children to engage in good, old-fashioned play. There are a lot of creative ways to use this slime and the included supplies. This is a wonderful product and would make an excellent gift.

title: Great Teaching Accessory
text: My wife teaches English as a second language and I got her this set of cards to use in her classroom. She has found them to be a very useful teaching accessory. The cards use models that represent people from all over the world which is helpful for creating an inclusive atmosphere in the classroom. The cards are durable and hold up well to repeated use. The storage box helps keep the cards organized and does not take up an excessive amount of space. Repetition is the key to language learning, and this set is a terrific teaching tool.

title: Fantastic and Educational
text:
This is a really nice construction set that will help promote creativity and problem solving skills. My daughters are 10 and 7 and they both love playing with this set. The app provides clear instructions and it's fun to watch my kids pause and look for direction as they build. Following complex directions and problem solving are good skills to develop and will serve them well in adulthood. It's terrific to have a set like this which teaches those skills in a way that's also fun.

The pieces are durable and my kids have already built things and taken them apart multiple times. I like that the set comes in a nice plastic case so that when your child has finished play, they have a convenient place to store all the pieces. This helps ensure that you won't be stepping on the pieces at night.

This is a can't miss item for a present. It is a nice size and the packaging makes it perfect for wrapping. Whether you're looking for a Christmas or birthday gift, this set would make an excellent choice.

title: Fun For the Whole Family
text:
The box says that the minimum player age should be 10, but we played with our 7 year old and she beat us on the first round. Gameplay is pretty easy to pick up, but I recommend doing a practice round of the first module to make sure you understand the scoring. Our error on our first round was that we didn't know each player started with 10 points, so when the time came to assess points, we all had negative totals. There is a very good YouTube tutorial to help you get started.

There are four identical cards and players lay out buildings that are similar to Tetris shapes around various landforms. The strategy comes from learning how to manage your board by keeping account of your remaining shapes. You can glance over at your remaining shapes to help plan your layout. It's important to leave spaces for some of the bigger shapes.

The fun part about this game is that it comes with a series of sealed envelopes that explain new variations. Sometimes you are able to earn points by grouping your buildings by color, or building around a well. You add stickers to the board as you go. The player that wins a round is given points in the overall scoring. However, when you win a round, you are likely to have to add a sticker to your board which has the potential to cost you points. This helps ensure competitive gameplay.

In addition to the legacy game, there are also rules for a single session game you can repeat as often as you like. My family found this game engaging and they enjoyed placing the pieces and learning new strategies. This is a good game that combines a lot of interesting concepts into an enjoyable final product.

title: Great For Kids
text:
These small basketballs are perfect for teaching basic skills to children. Regular sized basketballs are way too cumbersome and heavy for children to handle properly and only result in the development of bad habits. My kids are 8 and 10 and they love going out to the park to shoot with these balls. Eventually I plan to transition to regulation sized balls, but right now it's more important to cultivate a love of the game.

The balls come uninflated, but a small hand pump is included with the product. All you have to do is pump them up and hit the court! This is a perfect item for small children anywhere, and would make a thoughtful gift.

title: Makes a Great Gift
text: I got this for my daughter who just turned 8 and it was a tremendous success. This gift is like having multiple gifts in one because when you open the heart shaped package you find several additional smaller packages inside. The pack contains adorable figurines that absolutely delighted both of my daughters. The box works as a jewelry box and even has a mirror on the back of the cover. This is a delightful item that quickly captured the attention of my children.

title: Great Version of a Classic Game
text: This is a high quality version of the classic game we all spent time playing in our youth. The wooden pieces are much more pleasing to handle than the old plastic versions. The frame sets up quickly and after play the two pieces slide together  for compact storage. This is a fun game both for children and adults. The game encourages eye contact because players sit across from each other. In an era where children spend way too much time staring at digital screens, this game is a nice callback to a simpler time. This is a very nice product and would make a thoughtful gift.

title: Creative and Delightful Product
text:
I prefer items like this as gifts for young children because it allows for expression and lets the child engage his or her creativity. In a world where kids spend way too much time watching videos, a kit like this gives them a much needed excuse to engage other parts of their brain.

This kit includes everything you need to make some really cool fairy lanterns. My daughters were delighted by the creative process, and they enjoy using their lanterns as nightlights. This is a fun kit and a great gift idea.

title: Fun for Kids
text:
My wife enjoys diamond paintings, but we've found that a typical kit is too complex for children. This kit is a much more manageable size and is perfect for children to enjoy.

I like that this kit includes larger diamond sizes that produce a much more dynamic final image. Also, the larger diamonds allow your kids to progress at a more rapid pace. The kit includes a tray, a stylus, a labeled background, multiple bags containing the colorful diamonds, and a frame so you can showcase your completed project.

It's a very relaxing process to follow the indications on the background and apply the diamonds. The background has a sticky surface and is protected by a plastic film. You just have to peel back the film and begin application.

This kit is a perfect introduction to diamond painting. It's ideal for kids, but it's also a good starting point for adults who are curious about this kind of relaxing activity. The final image looks very nice.

title: Terrific for Explaining Basic Physics Concepts
text:
I am a Physics teacher and I know from experience that there is no better way to demonstrate basic concepts than to perform experiments. This kit comes with ten lesson plans that show you how to introduce a concept, explain how that concept is represented in an experiment, and then perform the experiment. Any teacher would be very satisfied with the step by step instruction manual provided with this set.

The building blocks are heavy duty and will hold up to regular classroom use. For parents who are homeschooling, this kit is a perfect way to help kindle your child's curiosity. Every experiment has a component that involves assembling the experiment apparatus out of the building blocks. This is the type of kit that allows kids to have so much fun that they forget that they are learning.

It comes in a large storage case and has a sorting tray for convenience. I was very impressed with the lesson plan book. This is a very good kit and will help to educate children both in the classroom and at home.

title: Very Detailed Model
text:
I got this item to make with my children and we've had a fun time with it so far. This is the first time we've built something like this so there is a lot to learn. All of the pieces are very small and it's easiest to assemble them with a tweezers. The pieces don't snap together, so we've been using small pieces of tape to hold the pieces together while the glue dries.

The kit helps develop an awareness for how furniture goes together. There is fabric to make bedding and even cushion stuffing to go inside chairs and give them form. The instructions are easy to follow and the pieces come in bags that are well-organized. I would compare this kit to putting together a 1000 piece jigsaw puzzle. It takes a lot of time and effort, but once you get into the flow it's relaxing. Please note that this isn't a kit that your kids can assemble and play with. It's more of a display model. The assembled pieces are very delicate.

This is the kind of kit that could help ignite an interest in architecture. It's fun, but it requires patience and precision work.

title: Good Quality Jigsaw Puzzle
text: My wife enjoys jigsaw puzzles and she was delighted to receive this. The image has a lot of bright colors and is both beautiful and soothing to look at. The puzzle comes in a very attractive box that slides open by pulling a ribbon at the end. The pieces are durable and unlikely to bend or fold as you are assembling the puzzle. This is a high quality item that will help you ease stress and relax as you put it together.

title: Good Family Fun
text:
This is a nice little drawing game that is appropriate for the whole family. The game consists of a timer, a drawing pad, four pencils, a large selection of cards, and a dice. You need at least two teams of two players each. You roll the dice and select a card, then read the category and draw the clue corresponding to the dice roll. Your teammate has to guess the answer.

If you roll a six it is an all-play, and each team also has three steal cards which they can use to jump in when their opponents are playing. Each time you guess a clue, you win the card. The first team to ten cards wins.

I liked that there is no game board. The game comes in a small box that is easy to transport. It's great for family vacations or game night.

title: Helps Kids Learn to Tell Time
text:
Children can become very frustrated with the concept of learning to tell time. They are still developing their comprehension of a base 10 counting system, and the 12 numbers of a clock face are confusing in a number of ways. The best approach for teaching children to tell time is through rote memorization rather than a theoretical explanation of concepts.

This set allows children to engage with a clock face in a way that's easy to understand. The kit includes two clock boards that are well-labeled and have minute and second hands that can be spun into position. I liked how the minutes were labeled all the way around the clock so kids can find the time they are looking for with ease.

The instruction manual provides rules for a number of different games that allow children to improve their ability to tell time. The cards and clock faces are of good quality and hold up to frequent handling and use. The clock faces are also dry erase boards, and my girls enjoyed writing down the times they were looking for and then cleaning off the surface.

If you have young children who want to improve their ability to tell time, or you're looking for a great classroom activity, this set is a good choice.

title: All the Fun and Less of the Mess
text: Kids these days love slime, however mixing it up is often a messy process that gets glue on everything. This pre-made slime comes in a convenient, resealable bottle that allows your kids to play to their heart's content without the risk of getting sticky hands or staining their clothing. The slime has a perfect texture and an agreeable scent similar to fruity bubble gum. This is a great product that offers all the fun of slime but eliminates all of the clean-up headaches.

title: Great For Kids!
text:
If you are looking for a cool item that will help inspire your children to put smart phones or other digital screens aside, then this is the perfect thing. The kit is a briefcase sized box filled with a ton of items that your children can use to create a variety of art projects. My girls are 7 and 9 and they squealed in delight at the first sight of this and ran off with it to engage in creative play.

If you are a parent looking for something to keep your kids occupied in a way that stimulates and engages their creativity, or you're a grandparent looking for a fun activity box for the weekend, this is a perfect choice. The craft items are good quality, and you'll be surprised and amazed at what your kids can create. Every household with small children needs a kit like this.

title: Drone Won't Pair With Remote
text: I was excited to get this drone because I thought my kids would enjoy the camera feature. It comes with an ultra micro memory card which you can insert into the back of the unit. However, after following the instructions and charging the battery, I have been unable to get this drone to pair with the remote control. I've read the instructions several times including the troubleshooting section. Perhaps part of the problem is that the instructions are not written in very good English. The drone lights up when it's plugged in, and the remote control turns on, it's just that the control will not pair and the drone will not work. I have double and triple checked to make sure I am following the correct procedures and I still cannot get it to pair. Maybe I received a dud.

title: Good, Clean Fun
text:
This is a very fun toy that is similar to the tracks I used to play with when I was little. There is always something fun about running a replica toy race car down a track, and even kids that have been raised on digital screens and video games will not be able to resist the appeal of this set. The track has a loop and when assembled the track is about 45" long and 13" tall at the highest point. The track is made of durable plastic that will hold up to rigorous play.

My girls are fans of 'Cars,' so they loved the Lightning McQueen detailing on the included car. Assembling the track is part of the fun, and they were able to do it all by themselves. It was good to hear the whizzing of car wheels combined with young laughter. I like any toy that can pry kids away from a television for any length of time, and this set certainly does that. This toy combines fun assembly with quality game play and makes a great gift.

title: Fun Remote Controlled Car
text:
This is a fun little car that is easy to operate and can hold up to the rough play of little kids. The controls operate each set of tires and feature forward and reverse. You turn the car by accelerating one set of wheels more than the other. You can make the car spin by holding one set of wheels in forward and the other set in reverse.

The car lights up so that you can find it easily if you accidentally drive it under a sofa or other furniture. The car operates on 4 AAA batteries and the remote requires 2 AA batteries. The battery covers are screwed into place which requires a small screwdriver. The only problem is that sometimes when you crash the car into something it dislodges the battery and you have to open the cover to reset it. As you get better at driving the vehicle this should happen with less frequency.

The car is durable and easy to drive. This is a fun choice for a first remote controlled vehicle and will delight any child that receives it.

title: Fun, Beginner Tech Kit
text: This is a fun kit that will allow your child the opportunity to examine and assemble technological component parts for creating synthesizer sounds. The two main pieces are a speaker and a control board. These pieces fit into a cardboard stand. I think there is great value to kits that allow children to assemble and disassemble tech devices, but I wish this kit had more applications. I like that it comes with the 3 batteries already installed. If you have a thoughtful child who is curious about learning the science of musical sound, this kit will be a nice accessory. However, this isn't the kind of gift you give to a child to keep them entertained on their own. The best part of this gift will be the time you spend with your child exploring what this kit has to offer.

title: A Nice Grooming Playset
text: My youngest daughter likes to arrange her stuffed animals in the morning when she's making her bed, so I knew she'd like this stuffed animal grooming set. The set comes with a convenient carrier and has a stuffed cat as well as a brush, a comb, and other accessories. The hair on the cat is supple and responds well to brushing. My daughter seems to find it relaxing to engage this this type of play, and I think it's important to encourage care giving impulses in children. Toys like this help give your children a reason to turn off the TV and engage in more creative and developmental play. The carrier is large enough to accommodate your child's other stuffed animals, and this set is sure to become a favorite.

title: The CDG Disc Comes In the Mail
text:
This is a really good concept, and you can use it to stream songs via Bluetooth or to play your CDs right out of the box. However, to get the full karaoke effect you need the CDG disk. CDG stands for CD plus graphics, and that's where you get the lyrics and the little bouncing ball. There is an option to go to a web page and type in the date code and receipt number. The manufacturer promises the CDG in 4-6 weeks once the information has been confirmed. So, if you're purchasing this for a gift, open it and send off for the free disc before you lose your receipt. If you purchase this on Amazon, you should be able to retrieve your receipt number from your purchases list.

The unit itself is very portable and easy for children to handle. The microphone is small enough that they can hold it easily. The volume for the unit is acceptable, but it doesn't get so loud that it will give parents or neighbors a headache. I wish they had included the disc rather than have the mail in option. However, there are many Disney Karaoke discs available to be purchased separately.

This is a very fun product that will entertain your kids. It does involve a bit of screen time with the lyrics, but I feel singing is a very social activity that provides a lot of positive stimulation. Singing is a creative pursuit, and this is a fun toy for parties. Your kids will have a blast, and they might even learn the introductory elements of audio engineering as a bonus.

title: A Fun Toy For Young and Old
text: This is a well-conceived little toy that is not as easy as it looks. Getting the cube transformed into a robot is pretty easy, but getting it back into a cube takes a little thought. The toy is made out of wood and is pleasing to hold and play with. The pieces are held together with an elastic band that slips into slots cut into the wooden components. It's brightly colored, and lightweight enough that you don't have to worry about children throwing it at each other. The wood is also smooth and there is no chance of splintering. This is a very fun, old school toy that children of all ages will enjoy.

title: Helps Stimulate Creativity
text: I love products like this which allow your children to play in a way that's creative and develop skills that could serve them as they grow older. This fairy dress making kit comes with everything kids need to create new fashions for their fairies. The kit comes with a lot of different accessories which you can see in the above photo. Kits like this are fun because they feel like they are multiple gifts all in one, you open the package and you get to keep opening all the little bags that have the decorative items. My daughters were delighted when they saw this and they've been playing with it regularly for the last few days. This is a great gift that will provide hours of creative entertainment!

title: Star Wars and LEGO is a Perfect Birthday Combination
text: If you are looking for a great gift for a young boy or girl for Christmas or a birthday, this is a great option. This 373 piece LEGO kit contains instructions for a speeder build, and then can be used for other creative projects. The kit includes figurines for Rey, two first order troopers, and BB-8. Note that although Kylo Ren appears on the upper right front corner of the box, there is no Kylo Ren figurine in this play set. The instructions are easy to follow and this is the perfect selection to distract your little ones from electronic devices for a few hours. LEGO toys also are great for teaching children how to follow complex instructions in a way they find rewarding and fun. You can never go wrong with LEGO, and this is a fantastic set.

title: A Delightful Fairy Toy
text: My youngest daughter just turned 7 so I was happy to get this magical fairy boat play set. My daughter has been a fan of fairies since she was very young, and we have spent time together making fairy houses in the garden. This set comes in a very large box that is a good size and weight for a birthday present. I liked that you have to spend a few minutes putting the boat together. The pieces all snap together with ease, and there are a few components that require tying string, but it's a very easy assembly. If you have other fairy figurines, this fairy boat integrates quickly into your child's world of play. This is a great toy for inspiring creativity and it helps your child entertain himself or herself with flights of the imagination.

title: Kids Love Disney's Frozen!
text: This is a really fun play set that your kids will appreciate. It has 116 pieces which is enough to keep your children busy and challenged, but not so much that they become frustrated or overwhelmed. My girls are 7 and 9 and this is the perfect size LEGO kit for them. The Frozen II theme helps inspire their imagination with scenes from one of their favorite franchises. This set includes figurines of Elsa and Sven which they absolutely love. The box is a good size and makes for an attractive present when wrapped. This is a great choice for a birthday party present. The combination of LEGO and Disney provides everything a child could ask for.

title: Great for Fans of Dragons or Game of Thrones
text: [[VIDEOID:fa00a70a63cdcfe679afc0ced1304fd7]] This is a really cool build set that is an ideal gift for anyone who likes dragons, Game of Thrones, or just enjoys doing a complex build. The blocks are similar to Lego, but Mega Construx offers articulated motion once the job is complete. That means that you're building a toy you can actually play with! The box says it has 735 pieces, and the instruction manuals are detailed and easy to follow. There are even cloth attachments to make the dragon's wings look real. The box says for ages 16+ but I have my 9 year old daughter working on this and she's having a great time. This Daenerys and Drogon set is the perfect way to pry your kids away from cell phones or television to spend a little quality time on a fun activity. Makes a great gift!

title: Everything You Need to Make Great Slime
text: Kids love slime, and this kit has everything you need for hours of fun, gooey entertainment. I don't know when the slime craze started, but in the era of screen addiction, I'm happy to find anything that entertains kids in the real world. Making slime is good, clean fun. If you're a grandma or grandpa, this kit would be a great choice for a day of visiting the little ones. Elmer's magical liquid slime activator works a lot better than home slime recipes you might find on the internet. Make sure you have a large bowl for making the slime, but once you have the mix right, this stuff is not sticky (although I still wouldn't recommend dropping it on a carpet or on furniture). Your kids will giggle and you'll have a blast, just make it and use it in a craft area.

title: Hours of Fun!
text:
This is a great quality play set with hundreds of pieces that will keep your kids occupied for hours. The box says 569 pieces, which is enough to build a lot of different objects.

As a parent, it's not hard to see the advantage of Lego sets. Although I think it's a little ridiculous to assume that your kid will grow up to be an engineer if they play with Legos, it's easy to see the benefit of a toy that makes children follow rigorous and complex instructions.

The build diagrams are a lot like you will encounter on any number of products in your lifetime, for everything from maintaining your vacuum cleaner, to the owner's manual of your vehicle, to how to put on a compression valve. The early you learn how to sit down and interpret an instructional diagram, the better equipped you are to deal with life.

The most amazing thing about Lego sets is that even though they are a rigorous mental exercise, kids love digging into them each and every time. This set is triple the fun as it contains the instructions for three different builds. My kids are 7 and 9 and they put together the boat in a couple hours. The boat even has a mechanism that allows you to spin a handle on the top and it makes the propeller spin (although we couldn't quite get the piece to set in place properly). Still, this is a complex build that gives a little bit of insight into gearing.

The best part is, once they're done building all the suggestions, they break the whole thing down and start constructing fortresses and whatnot. I have never seen a kid disappointed to receive a Lego set ever. Great toy.

title: Put It Together With My Girls, Lots of Fun
text:
This fire truck set is exactly what you would expect from a high-quality Lego set. I picked this up the other day to put together with my 9 and 6 year old girls. It kept them focused and busy for a couple hours, and it was fun to watch them work together and consult the directions.

I included several pictures with a penny to indicate scale. The item comes in a good sized box that is perfect for birthday or Christmas presents. The box size is large enough that it would look great when wrapped. Nobody likes to show up at a birthday party with a gift the size of a deck of cards. The size of the box is perfect for putting under a Christmas tree and letting your kids dream and wonder about what might be inside.

There are 201 pieces in this kit, so it takes a while to put together and can be torn down again for reuse or rebuilding. My youngest is 6, and this set is ideal for children both younger and older than she is. The only thing to be concerned with is allowing very young children to play with the set because young children tend to put things in their mouth and the small pieces are a choking hazard. The only other hazard to Lego sets is stepping on the pieces in the night and issuing a bloodcurdling scream that provokes your wife to call the police. As long as you put the pieces away, you should be able to avoid this embarrassment.

My kids liked how the fireman comes with a spring loaded fire hose that "shoots" little blue Lego pieces to combat a blaze. They don't go farther than about 4 or 5 inches unless you've got a really slippery floor. The wheels roll on the fire truck when built, so this is a cool little set. We had a great time, and I bet I can dismantle the truck, stick it in a box, and break it out again in four or five months for another fun day with the girls. Personally, I've never gotten sick of playing with Lego kits, and I bet your kids won't get sick of them either. Recommended.

title: Classic Game
text: My little ones asked for this game for Christmas and they had a ball playing with it. Life is a fun game because it doesn't quite start the fights you get from Monopoly or Risk. By the time you get to the end, everybody is pretty much ready to be done playing. The other thing is that even if you lose, you usually retire with several million dollars, so you figure you'll be okay. The only in game assault on another player is when they roll your magic number and you have to pay them 20k, or the occasional fine from an action card. But the numbers on these are minimal and don't cause hard feelings.

title: Good, but the Tubs are Kind of Small
text: The tubs were a little smaller than I anticipated, but it's still a lot of variety of Play-Doh for a good price. I got it for my 5 and 3 year old...those two can't play with Play-Doh enough.

title: Really great value sleeves
text:
These are really nice protectors. I liked them so much, I have now got them four times from this company, and I don't have any real complaints about any of them. I do wish they had more colors, green and dark blue specifically, so as to have the five main colors for Magic the Gathering. But more color choices is always good in my opinion.

Sleeves were as advertised, the backs of mine opaque and none missing or damaged. Shuffle was good and the price is as well. I would recommend these for sure if you are looking to save money.

title: Stains badly
text: Very fun, soft feel and stretch. It's a good amount of slime too. It smells very strongly of shaving foam, which is what they use to make this kind of slime. My hands after touching it were very strongly dyed blue. Most of the blue washed off, but not all of it. The charm was poorly painted. I'm sure a kid would care about none of this however and love it. Though I did find it fun/relaxing, the staining left me feeling like I'd rather just use a different slime.

title: Good dice, but not white
text: Very nice dice, they roll well and are a good weight. No flaws with the enamel, and easy to read, it's all very nice. Mine however were cream, not white. Off white at best. They certainly would have got five stars if they had been white like they said. So if you don't care about that, then these are very good dice and I'm sure you'll get many years of use out of them.

title: A great value for some
text:
I got the Mewtwo and Cinderace decks, which came with their respective rare card each and the card sleeves. Some other reviewers got more, I did not, but did get everything mentioned in the listing. These decks are simply the cards taken out of the Pokemon Acadamy starter set, and the Pokemon Go decks, but without any of the extra items. It's a better value to buy them from their proper sets, but if you don't care about the extras, then this product is cheaper, and adds in some value in the way of mystery. If that's your thing.

Overall, for a mystery Pokemon deck set, I think this was actually good. Not phenomenal, but good and probably a good gift for anyone that doesn't have any decks to play with. My only real complaint is this, it does not come with rules, and so you need to look them up online to learn to play, if you don't already know. However, Pokemon give these for free online, and they are much more in depth than any of the printed rules anyway.

title: Cute little koala set
text: Really cute little koala set. Typical Gund quality and value that we know and love. They're well made and look really good for the price. Gund is about the only brand of stuffed animal I buy anymore and this set didn't disappoint- just adorable!

title: Really cute and a good value. Sadly missing pieces.
text: Some of the eggs were missing parts like eyes sadly. If it weren't for that, it'd be a great set! They seem well enough made and the price is good.

title: Great for collecting your fav stickers
text: Nice little album, it was exactly as described, but smaller than some of the pictures. Stickers stick to it well, but can come off later to rearrange or use, which is what I really wanted. I'm glad to have it to keep my stickers all together now. May end up getting another one if I fill up my first one, but it holds more than I thought it would.

title: Kids really love it
text: Inside tray was pretty good. This was made for holding deck boxes, not singles, and it works very well for what it was made for. I really like that it has space for a play mat. The tray can be pulled out easy, and just used as a carry bag though if you'd prefer. Zippers were nice quality as was the material it was made out of and the sewing. Only bad thing I can find is that the Pikachu on mine is a very pale yellow compared to the picture. Otherwise, a great case, and cool looking as well.

title: Pretty dice
text: These dice are really pretty and are good quality. Sharp edges and the painting on them was well done. They are balanced and very lightweight. They came in a protective case, and they didn't have any scratches or flaws. Not a fan of the price, it's a lot more than dice used to be, and though they are nice, they aren't special.

title: Cool, very fun and easily adjusted
text: Instantly one of my favorite fidget toys. Nice and weighty, with a fun tactile click. It's very sturdy and the design is really cool. I've used this thing so much and it still works like new. It is easily adjustable, so if you want it to be easier to open all you have to do is slightly turn a screw.

title: Fun card game
text: Pretty fun game over all. My friends had trouble with a few of the rules, but learned it eventually. Not too much card art, but what it had was very cool and unique as well. Since this is just like a deck of cards, it is very easy to take with you just about anywhere. The quality of the cards was pretty good as well. Overall, I'd recommend this game as it is fun and portable.

title: Really cool model car, lots of fun!
text: I love this toy because it is not just a toy-it's a learning tool. I've seen my son learn so much from building and studying these cars. He has gained a lot of patience and dexterity, and the car building sets are the perfect tool to help him develop and refine his skills. The details in the car models are amazing, and the car is sturdy and fun to play with.

title: Another great game by Think Fun
text: Amazing and fun game. I like how high quality all the pieces are, everything looks great. I also like how well engineered it all is, all the pieces fit into the bottom part of the set, and the waterfall becomes the lid. The puzzles come in several difficulty levels, letting this level up with your child, or letting children of different ages all get some use out of it. Very easy to learn, and fun to play with for a long time.

title: Sturdy enough beach bag!
text: I use this to hold all of my dogs toys and it holds up well to be packed full of them! The mesh is a little on the thin side so you probably couldn't put anything too heavy in it but for lighter stuff it's great!

title: Disappointing
text:
Well made and without physical flaws. It was just, very underwhelming when you open the box. Mostly because it doesn't really make rainbows. Nothing like in the pictures. I don't know how they are doing it, but I can't get mine to do it, so it looks very plain and small. Price isn't the best on amazon either. But, it is what it says it is. So I can't really be too harsh with the rating. Just wish it was as stunning as it is in the pictures.

It does say in the listing, that it is "made of colored glass panels". No it isn't. I don't know why they claim that. Might be a mistranslation maybe?

title: Best brand for Pokemon mystery boxes
text:
Cards were in great condition, and sleeved together. They were worth less than four dollars, and the boosters around eight bucks for both, which comes to a total of around twelve bucks worth of cards. Which for a mystery card box, is actually a great value. This brand consistently puts out mystery boxes with values that are much higher than competitors.

No, you won't get twenty or more dollars of cards in the box, how could they make money that way? You're paying for the mystery really. If you are wanting to get a mystery box gift for yourself or another, this is the brand I recommend most to anyone.

title: A good mix of cards
text:
Cards came in great shape and were well packaged. I like that the box can act like a deck box as well. Each card has it's own sleeve, which I really like. It had no duplicates, however, the listing mentions a sticker, and other products from this company had a sticker, but this time I didn't get one. Not a big thing, just thought I'd mention.

I got three Pokemon V cards, and one Vmax, plus the Pikachu from celebrations that comes in most of these. All together, they were worth less than five bucks. Which, is a bad face value, but is average for mystery boxes. You buy mystery boxes for the mystery, not so much expecting you are going to get cards worth equal to what you pay, otherwise they'd just be selling those cards single.

Would be fun to get for yourself and would of course be a great gift.

title: Really fun blocks, but crazy expensive
text:
Really fun magnetic building blocks, I love the concept so much. I don't love mystery boxes though, I of course got the figure I liked the least. But that's the nature of mystery boxes. I wish they sold the figures separately, not as mysteries.

I only got twenty six blocks in my figure, and that makes each of the very tiny blocks super expensive, almost a dollar each. So I could never really get enough to build anything cool. Plus, it has so few colors. The figures made with these are cool looking though, so if you have a ton of money, then these are fun to have.

The box it comes in is way over sized. You could easily fit all sixteen figures in a single box with room to spare for many more. On the topic of waste, the amount of plastic bags is confusing and unnecessary. Magnets are strong enough, but I would have liked for them to be stronger.

title: Really fun blocks, but crazy expensive
text:

title: Not a great value
text: Really fun idea and a good time with the kids. Clay starts out hard like any unconditioned clay, but it softened right up after I kneaded it. Nice amount of colors as well. There is a very tiny amount of clay in this kit. Nowhere on the listing could I find out how much there was, but when I got it, each pack said it had nine grams, for a total of 216 grams. However, after weighing them, most didn't have nine grams in them. Just enough for one to three handprints depending on how thick you make the clay, and how large the hands are. It cured very nicely in the oven.

title: Fun for mystery box lovers, but pass for most others
text: Cards were in great shape, and none missing. I didn't get any bad cards, but I didn't get any good ones either. Quite a few that need specific cards to play them, that didn't come in my box. I like the box, but the inside flaps were folded wrong and are now bent up. Not a single card was worth more than a few pennies, making this a very bad value for the money. I only got ten repeats, so if you like mystery boxes, this isn't bad, but for most players, it'd be better to get booster packs. Or buy singles if you really want one card.

title: Pretty cool dice
text:
These dice are pretty cool looking, and you can be sure people are always fascinated when they first see them. They are light and larger than most dice. Being that light, they don't roll well once they have landed, so you have to give them some spin in the air. They take a while to charge fully, but then easily last a whole game after that. Because of the light, they are very easy to read as well.

I don't have any problem putting the dice back in the case or charging them, it really doesn't take any effort. But from other reviews, I'm really the odd one out on that, so you'll really have to consider if these dice are too much effort before you buy them.

My one issue with them is, too often (About one in five times) they just don't light up at all, which is their whole thing. I really wish they had been better about lighting up, as throwing a die and just having it not light up really kills the effect. Especially for the price.

But they are really cool, and magical looking. A massive step up from the ones that weren't rechargeable, leading to worthless dice after just a bit.

title: Good quality plush
text: Really nice plush of Brother Bear. Looks just like him, and it's nice quality material too. I'm very happy to have got this item, and can't find anything wrong with it. I've seen other companies try to make a plush of this character, but they did a terrible job on those. So I was happy to see what a good job Mighty Mojo did on this one. Very nostalgic for me.

title: Good quality plush
text: Really nice plush of Sister Bear. Looks just like her, and it's nice quality material too. I'm very happy to have got this item, and can't find anything wrong with it. I've seen other companies try to make a plush of this character, but they did a terrible job on those. So I was happy to see what a good job Mighty Mojo did on this one. Very nostalgic for me.

title: Cool looking dice
text: Stunning and very unique looking dice. They quickly grab attention at the table. Really love the color combo too. They are nice and weighty, and roll well. I absolutely recommend getting a set.

title: Great sleeves, terrible price
text:
The sleeves are near perfect, I really like them. They fit very snug on both my MtG and Pokemon cards. I can't imagine anyone not finding these good enough for their double sleeved cards. However, they are four to five times more expensive than KMC Perfect Fit (Also sold here on Amazon) and aren't quite as good. I mean, you'd have to be real picky about your sleeves (Which I am) to even notice the difference. I can't recommend getting these when they aren't as good, yet cost so much more than another brand.

Great sleeves, terrible price, so I split the difference and gave three stars.

title: Decent but way overpriced
text: Pretty decent card sleeves. I have found no problems with them, either while sleeving my cards or playing with them. They are nice and thick, and the front is very clear. The back is textured a bit too much, but not unpleasantly so. I like that they are not too loose or snug and hold MtG and pokemon cards very well. The price however.. I can get far better here on Amazon for less. Thirteen dollars is way too high for this product.

title: Decent but overpriced
text: Pretty decent card sleeves. I have found no problems with them, either while sleeving my cards or playing with them. They are nice and thick, and the front is very clear. The back is textured a bit too much, but not unpleasantly so. I like that they are not too loose or snug and hold MtG and pokemon cards very well. The price however.. I can get far better here on Amazon for less. Eight dollars is too high for this product.

title: Stunning beauty
text: Such beautiful dice. Very sharp, good colors and they roll well. The case it comes with is nice, and the magnets hold well enough to keep the lid on. The cellophane on the inside catches the light and gives the dice a magical look. Everyone that sees them loves them. I also like the dragon fleur de lis, it's quite unique.

title: Beautiful
text: Mine came without flaws and looks great. I really love the shape. I have a thing for polyhedrons since I love tabletop games. I also love colors. So I was very happy to get this. Though, it seems from nearly all other reviews, mine being in ok shape is more of a fluke than the norm.

title: Great storage
text:
Such a good deal on a generic 'Boulder'. For the price, this is so great. It's sturdy, holds together well and looks great. I feel my cards are safe when I use mine, and it looks good too. I love that it has a place for my dice and tokens. So happy with this and would love to get more. I really can't find any fault with it.

If they wanted to better match the MtG color scheme, I'd recommend getting a frosted clear or light white, so they have all five of MtG's colors represented. Maybe even darken the red and green, so they better match the black and blue. Or just more colors in general, people love color options.

title: Cool looking kite
text: This is one cool looking kite. Certainly not like anything I've ever seen for sale before. It was really easy to put together and it flew well once I had a day with good air for it. Can't find any faults with it, so I'd happily recommend it.

title: Fun set to build and display
text: Such a cool/cute build. Definitely more for adults, both the theme but also, the pieces are small and the instructions complex. I had so much fun with this set. The pieces are not compatible with other brands, but are very nice quality. The build is very well thought out and filled with detail. The stickers are nice as well. The pictures do not show it, but it comes with a nice looking figure that goes with the set. I would have liked the instructions to be a booklet, rather than a single large poster.

title: Beautiful dice
text: Really cool looking dice. They roll well and sound good in the hand and when rolled. The rainbow set really reminds me of bismuth crystals and I love them. They use a nice font and it's easy to tell the numbers apart. Everyone that sees them loves them. Overall, a great set.

title: Well made and very cute
text: Very, very cute and well made cards I love the unique art and theme of this set. As a collector of nice tarot sets, I'm happy to have this one. The cardstock used on these is very nice, and feels like it'll last a very long time. I like how the smaller sized set fits in my hands as well.

title: Very high quality
text: Really nice, high quality deck box. It was sturdy and the magnets held well. I felt my cards were very safe while using it. I like the combo of red and black as well. Easily holds all my sleeved cards, tokens and extras.

title: Such a cool set
text: Such a fun build of such a cool idea. Not only is the theme itself cool, but the little hidden drawer makes it more than just a space filling decoration. I really enjoyed making this. The pieces aren't as nice as I'd have liked, but for the price, I am not really shocked. As well, the set doesn't look as good as the pictures, go by the pictures posted by other reviewers to see what it really looks like. There were no missing pieces.

title: Huge and interesting puzzle
text: Very challenging, but fun puzzle. The image is quite entertaining, and also adds to the challenge. All the colors are similar, but they are different enough to tell apart. Pieces were nicely made, though they were all the exact same shape, which I found to be an odd choice and didn't like. Nonetheless, it was very fun, had no missing pieces and I recommend it if you like the image and want a challenge.

title: Fun for play or fidgeting with
text: Nice blue color, and is very soft and fun to play with. However, mine was half air inside, and these things really need zero air on the inside to keep the foam from drying on top inside the ball. The air also just doesn't feel good. Nonetheless, it is fun and good for playing with. Don't give to a kid that will be so rough on it that'll it'll pop and it'll be a great toy.

title: So far, they are the best brand for these
text:
All my cards added up together were only four bucks. Most cards were only one or two cents, and nothing over fifty. Nothing really exceptional in the box. But, for these mystery type boxes, you have to know you are buying bulk cards the seller can't sell for anything, and it's really all for the mystery. That being said, out of all the Pokémon mystery card packs I've ever got, this brand has so far been the very best. The cards were in great condition, and there was nice variety. No dragon or fairy types though.

The list price has gone up five bucks from when I bought and originally wrote this review, and I have taken another star off for that.

title: Expensive but very cool dice
text: Very heavy and beautiful dice. They roll well, and I like the font, it's unique and very D&D themed. The dice are very expensive for how plain they look though and their simplicity. A couple came loose in their box and lightly scuffed each other. It was very light though, and they'll pick up some wear as they are played with anyhow, so it wasn't an issue. The box feels a bit flimsy, but it looks nice. It's overall a very nice set, but for the money, I can find elaborate dice with a wooden box, so you have to really love the look of these. But if you do, then I would recommend them.

title: Awesome designs
text: First pack was missing an image, but a replacement was sent out, and that one was perfect. Very well made, and the pictures are really amazing. There are no bald spots in the velvet, and the paper is pretty decent quality as well. These are just so nice, I really love them, and look forward to getting more in the future. The additional poster with a few facts that was included was a nice addition.

title: Great gift
text: Very cute, and soft. Well made without any defects. This was an instant hit with the kids, and I can imagine any kid that loves Minecraft will love one of these.

title: A fun building set
text: A really great value compared to the other major brand. I like the look of the finished model and it stays together well enough, but it is more for display than playing with. The instructions are pretty good, but most young kids probably wouldn't do well with this model. I had a lot of fun with this, and I would recommend it for someone needing to save money, but loves a big t rex.

title: Awesome looking coins
text: Great look and feel to these coins. I even like the sound they make. It adds a lot of immersion to my games, but when I'm done with them, I'm going to put them in a treasure chest, and it'll look so good. The coins are a nice heavy weight and all fit in the cool bag provided.

title: A great challenge
text: Very fun but challenging puzzle. Took me quite some time to get it back together. Very sturdy cardboard frame and the picture is very nicely printed and detailed. Puzzles like these were always fun when I was a kid and they still are. I can see why they have sold so many millions. Highly recommended for kids or anyone that loves puzzles.

title: Stunning
text: Such a beautiful and stunning effect. These tarot cards are very bright and rainbowy, I love them. They always thrill and delight when I pull them out. The quality of the cards is quite nice, the booklet is no better than the usual free booklets you get with cards, so not great. I really recommend this to collectors of tarot cards or anyone just wanting a holofoil, rainbow deck for fun.

title: A fun wood kit
text: A fun project that results in a cool decoration. Instructions were adequate, though a few places I had to think a bit about what I was supposed to do next. It was nevertheless quite fun and I enjoyed the time spent building it and the finale product. Now to decide whether to paint it or not.

title: A great set for a beginner
text: This set really would be great for any beginner, or just someone that forgets a lot, like me. lol I was impressed by how much info they got on the cards. The cards are nice quality, both in printing and cardstock. The box they come in is very sturdy. I would highly recommend.

title: A great set for my decks
text: Really good deck boxes. They were all sturdy, no defects and the magnets were pretty strong. I felt my cards were really safe when I used them. The dividers are really helpful too. I like that it comes with one of each of the basic MtG colors, clearly what they were going for. I would definitely recommend this set.

title: Great dice
text: Very beautiful and elegant looking dice. They are heavy, sharp and roll well.  No defects and they come in a nice metal tin to keep them safe. You'll want to roll these on a dice tray or they are likely to leave small marks on a table. One of the best sets I've seen. Everyone that sees them loves them as well.

title: Terrible quality
text: Worst quality puzzle I've ever had. For thirty dollars, I can't believe it's that bad. So many of the pieces fit together, but you can tell they clearly don't go together, as the picture doesn't line up. There have been places where I have several pieces that will go in a spot, and the piece has so little picture on it, that you can't tell which one is supposed to go in that spot. A ton of dust in the box gets everywhere every time you fish more pieces out. The little nubs on the pieces break too easily, likely because the board is so thin. The top layer is also peeling on some pieces. This has not been fun in the slightest and I would never recommend a friend get this.

title: Such an awesome and large plushie
text: Such a soft and fluffy, derpy dino. It's so cute, and an instant hit. To save money, the dino is super compressed, I was shocked how small they actually got it. It took some mushing the stuffing inside to fluff him back out. But it was worth it for the savings. Everyone loves him, and I find it very hard to imagine someone not liking him. The stitching is nice and the quality of materials is good.

title: I love the map
text: Great little set here. I counted the items and you do indeed get the amount they say you will. The map is really cool, and the bag is nice as well. I got it to fill a little treasure chest, and it just looks so good. This would be great for so many little things, if you are needing fake gems or fake treasure, then this has got you covered. I fully recommend this set for all it's variety.

title: Really awesome dice
text: Very cool looking dice. The dice are also unique in design and font. The five and two can be a little hard to tell apart, but not by a lot. Nice and heavy, and they roll well. Everyone that sees mine loves them and I do too.

title: A great rock tumbler
text: A great rock tumbler. It came with everything needed, and worked perfectly. Make sure to read the instructions, and you'll be able to use this no problem. Pretty quiet compared to the ones from my childhood. If you want beautiful stones, then this will do a good job.

title: Easily one of the best things I've gotten from Amazon ever!
text: This was easy and fun to put together and the final product is absolutely stunning and adorable!! I keep my house decorated in magic/ Halloween decor all year so this little house looks so cute in one of my Halloween display cases! It's very good quality and definitely worth the $40 it's listed for right now.

title: Adorable little furby like toy
text:
I'm a Millenial and saw this and figured it was similar to a Furby so I got it for my niece and she loves it! I don't know why someone would say this made their kid cry- this thing is fluffy and adorable! It's not some scary demon and it's not teaching kids curse words, it's just a toy and there's really not much more to it than that. It takes 3 AAs (not included) and you'll need a little screwdriver for the battery compartment (also not included.)

Seems like a cheaply made toy, I don't see it lasting forever but for now it functions as it should and all of it's features work. For the price- I think it's a good deal. The furbys did less than this and they sold for $35 to $50 in the 90s. So this isn't a bad deal at all. It's a cute little unique toy!

title: Looks more like a dollar store $10 car. The "decals" are cheap thick cardboard junk!
text:
They printed the decals on cardboard or something thick and attached those to the car all over. Since it's thicker and inflexible- they had to put slices in the graphic so it would "flex" enough to conform to the car. It looks like someone got bored with a box cutter and went after the car- the cuts look terrible! I don't understand why they couldn't make a vinyl graphic and stick it on there... This truly looks like a $5 or $10 junky thing from a dollar store.

Functionality wise, it works about how you'd expect a race car in this price range to work. Sure it goes fast but it doesn't go super fast all the same. No traction from the tires. This is a good toy for a small kid that isn't serious about race cars and wouldn't know the difference between this and a real rc car.

title: Best fidget toy ever
text: The best and most addictive fidget toy I've ever had. Good weight to it, feels and sounds nice and is so small, I can take it anywhere. The only one I've found in silver, and I hate gold, so I really like that. Right now, it's half the price as the others. Mine had no flaws and I have used it a ton and it still works perfectly. Can be loud, or quite, depending on how you use it.

title: Great deck box
text: Fun deck box, sturdy too. It can fit two sleeved Pokémon decks easily, and the dividers are great at keeping things organized. The fabric on the outside is one I've never seen on a deck box before, it looks and feels good and sets it apart from others. The magnets are strong and I feel my cards are safe and secure in the box. My Pikachu had a small spot on his tail that wasn't fully gold, but it is small.

title: Fun and quick card game
text:
One of the best card games I've ever played. It's easy to learn, and quick to play. I love how it has so much variety, I don't think I've had a game yet, similar to another even after countless games. I would 100% buy again.

My friends don't like to play games that require a ton of rule learning, that take forever to learn, and they are quite fickle with games, but even they love this game and are always up to play it. So if they like it, I think most people would.

As well, the new version has a cooler box and comes with a playmat and is cheaper than it was when I got mine; so I think it's really a must buy.

title: Missing cards
text: My set was missing cards. There were errors on many of the cards, some small, but a few were really big. Some of the most expensive cards, but also the worst. A bad combo.

title: The very best CMY cube
text: I have bought several CMY cubes from other brands, and they were all garbage. I wasn't going to get this one at first, until I saw they were the original makers, and knowing how nice theirs were, I bought one, and I love it. It has no defects, light goes through nicely and it makes all the colors it's supposed to. I 100% recommend this brand if you are going to get a CMY cube, the others were a waste of time.

title: A truly amazing set
text: Loved this set, it was fun to put together, was huge and looks cool. The Butterfree was well made. Tons of pieces for a decent price, and none missing or damaged. Instructions were good and in full color. This set can combine with the other sets from this line, which I think is really awesome, and adds extra value. I've always enjoyed builds by Mega, and this entire line is no different.

title: Always good quality from Mega
text: Loved this set, it was fun to put together and looks cool. Lots of pieces for a decent price, and none missing or damaged. Instructions were good and in full color. This set can combine with the other sets from this line, which I think is really awesome, and adds extra value. I've always enjoyed builds by Mega, and this entire line is no different.

title: A nice set for the game table
text: Beautiful dice, no defects at all and great quality overall. They are well balanced too. The wooden box and bag are a really nice addition to these dice. Would recommend and would love them to make this set in more colors.

title: Super cute but super cheap and crappily made sadly
text: These have some sort of lamination on them and all of my cards are bubbly and weird looking because the lamination on their pictures is coming up. (Picture putting a piece of packing tape over a card and it bunching up, that's what these look like. The price point is really fair on these but It's not a great trade off to pay less money and get ugly terrible-quality cards. If they fix the issue with the laminating on them, these cards would be absolutely beautiful and perfect! They're very shiny and look great!

title: Affordable little set, love this!
text: This is probably the cheapest Lego set I've ever got and where it's small and simple, it's a really good value and all of the parts in this are perfect quality! Can't beat the price at all for this great set!

title: Very adorable ice cream truck set!
text: This set was easy to put together and it's so cute! Perfect quality on all the parts as is usual with Lego products. Everything looks perfect and we have no issues at all with this cute set!

title: Cute little value set
text: This is a good budget set that has some cute figures and some other accessories. Everything is great quality and it's been a lot of fun playing with them. Love these!

title: This stunt challeng line of Legos is a lot of fun!
text: We have a few different stunt Lego sets from this series and they're all a lot of fun to play with, even for adults like us! When not playing with them, we have them in one of our glass display cases with the other Legos and they make a really neat decoration too! Flawless quality craftsmanship.

title: Cute little set
text: This is a cute little affordable set that has a lot of pieces and a couple cute figures with it. Typical Lego high quality parts, everything snaps together perfectly and looks amazing!

title: One of the coolest sets I've found in a while!
text: This set has it all from skeletons to a treasure chest with gems in it, it's just too awesome! Everything is typical Lego high quality and the parts all go together flawlessly. This set is a lot of fun and looks really good in my display case- I love it!

title: Cute set, could use more animals or a lower price
text:
Only has like 2 different animals and the price seems a bit high for how little comes with it. Lego should lower the price or include more animals so you have a variety of them.

Other than that, the set is of great quality and is a lot of fun to play with!

title: A nice firm putty with extra value
text: This putty is so much fun on it's own, but adds another element to it's play. Being able to write and draw on it in the dark really does make it so much more fun than ordinary putty. I love that it comes with a little light as well. A good value. As well, since it's putty and not slime, you never have to worry about it getting moldy or drying out.

title: Such beautiful cards
text: Such beautiful cards, even the tin is beautiful. I love that they are a nice quality plastic, they should last just about forever. The texture is very nice, I have never had plastic cards with texture before and I love it, it makes playing with them worlds better. My other plastic cards have the ink printed onto the plastic, and the images rub off, but this company has somehow done it differently, the images aren't coming off, no matter how much I play with them; amazing. If you are looking for a new set of playing cards, I can easily recommend this set.

title: Super fun
